full_content.content: Common reasons your Hotpoint washer is not draining
The most common reasons your Hotpoint washer is not draining are a broken motor, malfunctioning electronic control board or a jammed door lock assembly.
We can help! Our service technicians have repaired over
Hotpoint washers. We can fix yours no matter where you bought it.
Most common repairs needed to fix a Hotpoint washer

A broken washer motor will prevent the spin basket from rotating or agitating, and can also cause a variety of other issues that affect the washer’s ability to function properly. Signs that the motor is wearing out include unusual noises during operation, such as grinding or squealing sounds. The washer may also exhibit erratic spinning or agitation, with clothes not being properly rinsed or still soaking wet after the spin cycle. Additionally, a worn-out motor may lead to the washer not completing its cycles, stopping abruptly, or not starting at all. Burnt smells or overheating around the motor area can be indicative of internal problems. In some cases, visible damage to the motor itself may be apparent.
How to replace the motor in a washer

A malfunctioning electronic control board can lead to various failures in a washer. This is because the board serves as the brain of the washer, controlling crucial components such as the water valve, drive motor, drain pump, and cycles. If the electronic control board fails, the washer may not power up or display the cycle status. Additionally, it might fail to fill, agitate, spin, or drain. In some cases, a shorted board may emit a burning smell.
How to replace the electronic control board in a washer

When a washer door lock assembly is jammed, you may encounter difficulty in opening or closing the washer door. The door may not latch properly, leading to issues in starting or completing a wash cycle. The washer might display an error code indicating a door lock problem. During operation, the door lock may make unusual clicking sounds or fail to engage, preventing the washer from starting. Additionally, if there is a malfunction, the door lock indicator light may not illuminate as expected. Users might notice water remaining in the drum even after the wash cycle has finished, indicating a potential problem with the door lock assembly preventing proper drainage.
How to replace the door lock assembly on a washer
What to expect when you experience a Hotpoint washer not draining issue
How is the not draining problem fixed?

Correcting most not draining problems usually involves replacing the motor, electronic control board or door lock assembly. However, there are many potential causes, so a thorough diagnosis is key to fixing the problem. An accurate diagnosis is essential to understanding how much the repair will be.
Why is my Hotpoint washing machine not draining water?

Your Hotpoint washer won’t drain if the house drain for the washer is clogged. Check to see if water drains through the stand pipe. If not, clear that drain using a plumber’s snake. If you’re unable to clear the drain on your own, have a plumber clear it.
A clogged drain hose will keep your Hotpoint washer from draining. Check the end of the drain hose for a lint clog. Clear lint and debris from the end of the drain hose if it’s clogged.
Use a wet/dry shop vacuum to suck water and possibly a clog out of the drain hose. The washer may drain properly after taking this troubleshooting step.
and check the drain pump. If the pump is clogged and you can’t remove the clog or if the pump is damaged, replace the drain pump.
Here’s a video that shows how to replace a drain pump in a washer:
If you’re unable to replace the drain pump or fix the washer drain failure on your own, schedule
service and we’ll send a Sears Home Services technician to your home to fix the problem.
Sears Home Services recommendations for a washer that is not draining

When the washer is not draining it can be for many reasons. To avoid replacing unneeded parts we recommend having a Sears Home Services professional perform diagnostic tests to identify the root cause of the problem. Our technicians are experienced at diagnosing all types of washer failures.
What to look out for with a washer not draining diagnosis

Diagnosing modern appliances without proper knowledge and training can be difficult. Without using proper diagnostic techniques, fixing your washer problem will only be achieved through changing parts on a hunch. Appliances, especially in the last 10 years, have become extremely advanced, and many models have electronic parts that are difficult to test. DIY repairs on the latest appliance models are becoming increasingly difficult.
Hotpoint Washing Machine Not Emptying Troubleshooting
Finding that your Hotpoint washing machine is not emptying out the water can be upsetting and troublesome. Sometimes, you can fix the washer drain problem yourself with basic troubleshooting steps.

A Hotpoint washer won’t spin the clothes if it can’t balance the load. Open the washer lid and check to see if all the items inside the washer are clumped together in a tangled ball. If so, untangle the clothes and evenly distribute them loosely throughout the spin basket. Start a Drain & Spin cycle to see if the washing machine drains and spins the load properly.

If you see excessive suds in your Hotpoint washing machine not emptying out water, add a half cup of white vinegar to help dissipate the excessive suds and run a Drain & Spin cycle. The drain pump won’t be able to pump out water with excessive suds but the vinegar will typically help reduce the suds and help the washer drain. After the load spins out, run a new cycle without adding any detergent to rinse the excess suds and vinegar out of the clothes.

Going forward, use less detergent to prevent excess suds. You should only need about a tablespoon of detergent to clean most loads in a Hotpoint HE washing machine. Also, make sure that you’re using HE (High Efficiency) laundry detergent. Using non-HE detergent will cause excessive suds in a Hotpoint HE washing machine.

These basic troubleshooting steps may help you resolve a problem when your Hotpoint washing machine is not emptying out water. If not, a component failure inside the washer such as a failed drain pump, wiring failure or bad electronic control board could be causing the drain problem. Schedule washer repair service through Sears Home Services to have a technician visit your home and fix the washing machine.
If your Hotpoint washer wraps up with water still in the tub, clogs or a failing pump can be the culprit. Standing water can breed mildew and odors. Instead of dealing with soggy clothes, schedule
. Proper drainage keeps your laundry station fresh.

full_content.content: Why isn't my Hotpoint washer draining?
A clogged drain hose, faulty drain pump, or a broken lid switch can prevent your Hotpoint washer from draining. Inspect these components to find the issue.
Could a clogged drain hose prevent my Hotpoint washer from draining?
Yes, if the drain hose is clogged, the washer will not drain properly. Check and clear any blockages in the hose to restore drainage.
How can I fix a Hotpoint washer that isn’t draining?
Start by checking the drain hose for clogs, and ensure the drain pump is functioning correctly. If the pump is faulty, it will need to be replaced.
What should I do if my Hotpoint washer still isn’t draining after clearing the hose?
If clearing the hose doesn’t fix the problem, inspect the lid switch and pump for malfunctions. A technician may need to replace these parts.

full_content.content: How Does a Mixing Valve Work?
Learn how a mixing valve works to control water temperature in a washer.
What is the drum of the washing machine?
The drum is the core part of the washer that holds your laundry and enables the cleaning process through rotation, agitation, and rinsing.
Hard water is water that contains high levels of dissolved minerals, particularly calcium and magnesium. It contrasts with soft water, which has lower concentrations of these minerals.
What is a Washing Machine Pedestal?
A washing machine pedestal is a platform that raises the washer off the ground, providing easier access to the appliances and often includes additional storage space such as drawers.

A washer tub is the interior part of a washing machine where clothes are placed for washing, typically made of stainless steel, plastic, or porcelain-coated metal, designed to hold water and withstand the agitation or spinning during the wash cycle.
Additional possible Hotpoint washer symptoms you may experience
Hotpoint washer won't spin or drain
These washer brands may also experience not draining

Notice of Right to Opt Out of Sale/Sharing

This website uses cookies and other tracking technologies (“Cookies”) to serve targeted ads, enhance user experience, and to analyze user activity. Some Cookies may collect personal information that is used in a way that is considered a “Sale”, “Sharing”, or “Targeted Advertising” as those terms are defined under various state privacy laws. full_content.content: You can move the toggle above to the left to opt out of Cookie-based Sales, Sharing, and Targeted Advertising. Please note that your opt-out choice is specific to this website, browser, and device. If you access other Transformco websites, you will need to make your election for each. Also, if you clear your Cookies on this browser or use another browser or device, you may need to opt out again on this website.

Please note: Opting out may affect our ability to personalize your experience on this website, though we may use Cookies that do not include Sales, Sharing, or Targeted Advertising. You may still receive non-personalized advertisements on other sites or personalized ads that may be based on information processed before you opted out.

This website recognizes the Global Privacy Control (“GPC”), which is designed to recognize certain browser-based opt-out preference signals. We will process the GPC signal as a request to opt out. To process your request through GPC, you must use a browser or browser extension that supports the signal and turn it on for each browser and device you use.
